DADOS-GERAIS.NOME-EM-CITACOES-BIBLIOGRAFICAS: BEREJUCK, M. D.;BEREJUCK, MARCELO DANIEL;BEREJUCK, MARCELO D.

RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH:
Dr. Marcelo Daniel Berejuck has worked for 22 years as an R&D engineer at Telecommunication industries (Digitro, Intelbras S.A.). He is a specialist at Digital Signal processing for Telecommunications (at UFSC - Federal University of Santa Catarina), with experience in DSP and Programmable Logic (FPGA) designs. He has a Master of Science degree at Embedded Systems at (UNIVALI - Itajai Valley University) and Ph.D. in Automation and System Engineering at (UFSC). He has worked as Assistant Professor at the Electrical Engineering Department (UNISUL - University of Southern Santa Catarina) from 2006 up to 2016 (Digital Systems, Microcontrollers, and Microprocessors, Software Engineering for Embedded Systems). Since 2016, he has joined the Engineering Department at UFSC as Associate Professor. Now he is a Member of the Embedded Systems and Microelectronic Laboratory (LSEM), and RexLab. 
Professional interests: Network-on-Chip (NoC), System-on-Chip (SoC), Embedded Systems, and FPGA applications, Engineering Education.
RESUMO-CV.TEXTO-RESUMO-CV-RH-EN:
Dr. Marcelo Daniel Berejuck has worked for 22 years as an R&D engineer at Telecommunication industries (Digitro, Intelbras S.A.). He is a specialist at Digital Signal processing for Telecommunications (at UFSC - Federal University of Santa Catarina), with experience in DSP and Programmable Logic (FPGA) designs. He has a Master of Science degree at Embedded Systems at (UNIVALI - Itajai Valley University) and Ph.D. in Automation and System Engineering at (UFSC). He has worked as Assistant Professor at the Electrical Engineering Department (UNISUL - University of Southern Santa Catarina) from 2006 up to 2016 (Digital Systems, Microcontrollers, and Microprocessors, Software Engineering for Embedded Systems). Since 2016, he has joined the Engineering Department at UFSC as Associate Professor. Now he is a Member of the Embedded Systems and Microelectronic Laboratory (LSEM), and RexLab. 
Professional interests: Network-on-Chip (NoC), System-on-Chip (SoC), Embedded Systems, and FPGA applications, Engineering Education.

OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES.OUTRAS-INFORMACOES-RELEVANTES: Between 1999 and 2015, several international trips were made to develop products in partnership with international companies or acquire technology. During this period, companies from the following countries were visited: Taiwan, Hong Kong (China), South Korea, Japan, the United States, Canada, Germany, Slovenia and Israel.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The proposed PABX system was developed with hardware based on spacial switching. Its capacity is up to twelve extensions and ten CO interfaces. More information is available at https://www.intelbras.com/pt-br/busca/?q=modulare%20i

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: BEREJUCK, M. D.;BEREJUCK, MARCELO DANIEL;BEREJUCK, MARCELO D.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Central Digital ImPacta (16, 40, 140, 220 e 300). - PABX Systems
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Development of hardware and firmware for PABX communication equipment, based on TDM technology (Time-Division_Multiplexing). The equipment support up to two E1 digital links and VoIP communication board. The CPU Board uses a DSP and an FPGA to switch and control all the interfaces of the PABX system ( more than 40 ports). The ImPacta line is a platform, and different models were developed over ten years. More information ereat: https://www.intelbras.com/en-us/central-pabx-hibrida-impacta-140

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Safety system for wood cutting machine used in the molding industry.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: In a study carried out on the relationship between violence and work process, based on official records of work accidents, both national and international, it reported that the transformation industry, a branch of more significant global importance, presented a proportion of 26.5 % of total cases of work accidents [Report from Industry and Commerce Ministry of Brazilian Government]. In that study, the timber industry is highlighted due to the frequency and severity of accidents. It can be observed by the type of damage to the worker, the frequency of permanent injuries and deaths, and the long period of absence from work. A cause of accidents in the timber industry is related to the low automation index of the processes related to wood cutting machines. In two cross-sectional studies conducted in Canada, the authors analyzed the relationship between mechanization of wood cutting activities and the frequency and severity of occupational accidents. They compared the accident rates between a mechanized process and a conventional production process using data from two companies. The results of these studies showed that the mechanization of the productive process presented a risk to work accident almost three times lower when compared to the conventional sector. Another study, carried out in Finland, also points out that the mechanization and automation of the production process in the wood processing industry reduced the average risk of accidents. In this context, the primary purpose of this project is to create an electronic system capable of controlling the low-cost wood cutting machines. High-end machines are quite expensive for small timber companies, and small companies are the majority in Southern Brazil. The proposed system will help the activities of an employee in a pneumatic wood cutting machine. The system will be read the wooden bar and defining the cutting locations to remove the imperfections of the part, increasing the distance of interaction of the saws with the employees and reducing the risks of work accident maintaining the efficiency of production and maximizing the use of wood. In addition to eliminating the risk of cutting, it will also eliminate frequent contact with dust and sawdust from wood cutting, providing a cleaner and more comfortable working environment for workers.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: BEREJUCK, M. D.;BEREJUCK, MARCELO DANIEL;BEREJUCK, MARCELO D.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Development of a project using blockchain techniques for security and access control in remote laboratories.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Problems related to data security issues, information and access credibility become more and more common when we talk in remote laboratories. As they are of great importance in scientific development, especially in universities, this type of laboratory is becoming more and more common. With these significant problems also evolve and must present new and current solutions, especially regarding the issue of verification of access to them and the reliability of data transmitted. Therefore, research and projects must be developed to provide new proposals for the solution of these main problems. A research project using blockchain techniques is proposed as a new way to obtain safe access to laboratories as such technique is currently little discussed for this specific purpose. At the end of the project, it is expected to result in a security project to remote laboratories with high reliability.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: BEREJUCK, M. D.;BEREJUCK, MARCELO DANIEL;BEREJUCK, MARCELO D.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Development of an e-learning FPGA platform following the IEEE SA 1876 - 2019 standards for Networked Smart Learning Objects for Online Laboratories.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
Low budget is a common problem faced by South-American universities, and many other universities and vocational education institutions. The learning of Hardware Description Languages, like VHDL or Verilog, is compromised due to the lack of FPGA 1 development boards for undergraduate students from those institutions. It is an issue that can be addressed with a hardware remote Labs: a solution that has been adopted by institutions offering undergraduate courses via distance education. The hardware remote lab development for
this purpose demand planning of the technology that will be adopted, to prevent problems for the whole system, such as secure access, system retrieving, or data storing. We are proposing the development of an e-learning FPGA platform that will be guided by good practices available on the IEEE SA 1876 - 2019 standard.
We noticed that so far, there is no one remote Lab dedicated to the learning of FPGA. At the end of the project, we are expecting the delivery of a fully functional FPGA platform for e-learning, further scientific papers related to this development.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: BEREJUCK, M. D.;BEREJUCK, MARCELO DANIEL;BEREJUCK, MARCELO D.

PARTICIPACAO-EM-PROJETO.NOME-UNIDADE: Departamento de Tecnologias de Informação e Comunicação

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO:
The World Pendulum Alliance (WP@ELAB) is a project that began on 11/15/2018 and is aiming to finish on 11/14/2021. The European Commission-funded it through the Education, Audiovisual and Culture Executive Agency (EACEA). EACEA is an agency of the European Union, through the Erasmus+ Program (Key Action: Cooperation for innovation and the exchange of good practises Action Type: Capacity Building in higher education) 598929-EPP-1-2018-1-PT-EPPKA2-CBHE-JP (https://ec. europa.eu/programmes/erasmus-plus/projects/eplus-project-details/#project/598929-EPP-1-2018-1-PT-EPPKA2-CBHE-JP). The project coordinated by Instituto Superior Técnico de Lisboa (Portugal), has the following European and Latin American institutions as primary partners in the consortium: Czech Technical University (Czech Republic); Ecole Centrale de Marseille (France); Linkare TI - Information Technologies (Portugal); Pontifícia Universidade Católica do Rio de Janeiro (Brazil); Universidad Catolica Santa Maria Antigua (Panama); Universidad de Chile (Chile); Universidad de Los Andes Fundacion (Colombia); Universidad Nacional Abierta y a distancia (Colombia); Universidad Tecnica Federico Santa Maria (Chile); Universidad Tecnlogica de Panama (Panama); Universidade de Brasília (Brazil); Universidade de Lisboa / Instituto Superior Técnico (Portugal); Universidade Estadual de Santa Cruz (Brazil) and Universitat Politecnica de Catalunya (Spain). Each higher education institution (HEI), participant of the consortium, will receive 12 pendulums: 1 primary will be installed in the HEI itself, and 11 secondaries, which will be installed in its associated partners. UFSC, as an associated partner of the University of Brasilia, will receive one apparatus, which will be installed in the Remote Experimentation Laboratory (RExLab) at the Araranguá campus. WP@ELAB is a project whose main goal is to build a global network of remote experiments controlled through the Internet.
Initially, pendulums, adapted to be remote experiments, will be placed in different strategic parts of the planet to collect data on the value of gravity's acceleration at different latitudes. The WP@ELAB world pendulums and their portal were developed by the Instituto Superior Técnico de Lisboa (IST) and partner company Linkare. Each apparatus can provide: the basic experience of a pendulum, study energy balances and oscillation damping, the variation of local gravity with latitude and altitude, and study the variation of the pendulum period with the length and with the amplitude of the oscillation. Through WP@ELAB, students of all educational levels and the general public will be able to collect data from different points on the earth directly and thus have the opportunity to study our planet's physical characteristics individually. The pendulum experiments have always been used transversally in different levels and school contexts due to its simplicity, yet rich in scientific information, becoming a great experiment to provide diversified objectives, covering several educational levels. Access to the pendulums will be supported by an online portal that will allow users, high school students, teachers, and university students to access a web page and perform data acquisition online of their experimentation. The data can be chosen from worldwide providers that will keep the pendulums working in different geographic points of the planet. The World Pendulum Portal will allow, besides remote online experimentation, access to didactic material to support practical activities in the form of personalized educational content for the World Pendulum, such as experimental protocols.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: BEREJUCK, M. D.;BEREJUCK, MARCELO DANIEL;BEREJUCK, MARCELO D.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.NOME-DO-PROJETO: Postural control and muscle activation during functional activities in individuals with Parkinson's disease and effectiveness of physiotherapeutic interventions.
PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: Parkinson's disease (PD) is one of the most common neurodegenerative conditions. Considering the current increase in demographic changes in increasing proportions, eventually, the Public Health System will demand special care for the elderly population. In Brazil, IBGE announced in its last report that the projection of people aged 60 years or older would be 73.5 million by 2060, which will contribute to the emergence of diseases associated with senility as PD. Postural instability arising from the disease is progressive and manifests itself during dynamic activities, especially in the transfer and initiation of gait. Most falls correlate with transfer movements and have a significant risk in these patients. The main objective of this research is to analyze morphofunctional variables and the behavior of postural control and muscle activation in functional activities in individuals with pre and post physiotherapeutic intervention. We decide to adopt two methods, which means the research will have two phases. Initially, a cross-sectional study of the observational type, in which the postural control through the force platform and the muscular activation through the surface electromyographic characteristics of the multifidus, rectus femoris, tibialis anterior and soleus muscles will be analyzed during the sitting movement for (ST-DP), sitting to stroll (ST-PD) and gait initiation (IM). Comparative analysis among individuals with PD at different stages of the disease and with healthy individuals. In the second phase, a controlled clinical trial, in which the effectiveness of physiotherapeutic interventions in functional activities will be analyzed. Analysis between the experimental group, composed of individuals with PD who performed the intervention and control group who did not perform. An analysis of postural control, muscular activation, and morphofunctional variables: anthropometric, hemodynamic, neuromotor and cardiorespiratory variables will be performed before and after a physiotherapeutic intervention program through multicomponent exercises with cognitive-motor stimulation.

INTEGRANTES-DO-PROJETO.NOME-PARA-CITACAO: BEREJUCK, M. D.;BEREJUCK, MARCELO DANIEL;BEREJUCK, MARCELO D.

PROJETO-DE-PESQUISA.DESCRICAO-DO-PROJETO: The junction of the Itoupava river and Mãe Luzia river forms the Araranguá River. It has an average flow of 53 m3/s and presents east-west general orientation, meandering windings and in the mouth. It moves northeast along the coastline for about 7 km before emptying into the sea. Near the mouth the main activity developed is fishing. The canal presents an irregular bottom, and along the river course, the Araranguá river presents an average depth of approximately 7.5 m, varying from the minimum of 2.5 m near the mouth to the maximum of almost 12 m, located 30 km upstream. According to Epagri (Brazilian Foundation for Research in Agriculture), the salinity of the irrigation water increases the osmotic potential and reduces the water potential, hindering the water absorption by the plants. High concentrations of salts in irrigation water can cause toxicity to plants. The irrigated rice has a moderate tolerance to salinity, being its productivity influenced by its degree in the water. According to Brazilian Agriculture Ministry, a reduction in the production of 0, 10, 25, and 50% for electrical conductivities of 0 to 2 of 2.1 to 2.6 of 2.7 to 3.4 and of 3, 5 to 4.8 mmhos / cm, respectively. The culture of irrigated rice behaves less tolerant to salinity in the initial and reproductive phases and moderately tolerant in the intermediate phases of its development. In an opinion on the salinity of the Araranguá River EPAGRI, 2011, points out several solutions to the problem, among them: "Climate Monitoring: Continuously monitor the flow of the river and the electrical conductivity of the water and weather forecast, associated to an efficient process to contribute to the preventive process to avoid serious harm to producers ". Thus, it is clear that the monitoring of salinity and pH conditions in the lower and middle estuarine portion of the Araranguá River may favor planning for irrigation, avoiding the withdrawal of water from the river when it does not present the prime rates for the harvest. Monitoring should be systematic and automated, giving independent farmers, business owners, and cooperatives information on the position of the estuarine salt wedge and the depth of the presence of the salt. The present project foresees the development of a platform for the monitoring of the physical-chemical conditions of the Araranguá river, in terms of salinity, pH and water temperature. Therefore, data collection sensors, sensor networks for data transmission and the data storage, processing and synchronization with a mobile device will be required. The scientific relevance lies in the proposed solution to the problem, which is considered to be a large scale environment. One of the relevant questions to be investigated is the different types of wireless networks for the transmission of data from Rio to the server at UFSC Araranguá, and consequently the synchronization with the mobile devices of those interested. Note that wireless sensor networks (WSNs) are complex distributed systems, primarily when used for long distance problems, as is the case presented in this project. Definitions regarding the resources employed, the most appropriate topologies to perform the monitoring, scope and storage tests of information, configuration and research of security issues, stand out as research interests associated with the proposed work.
